page.title: 08FARMING
page.content:
The farmland lies inland of the railway. The soils are varied as they have developed on glacial drift material of sands and boulder clay. Some parts are below Spring High Water level and rely on a drainage network, with pumping stations, to prevent water-logging.
The climate is mild with January temperatures averaging 4 degrees Celcius; July averages are about 15 degrees. Late spring frosts are rare.
The annual precipitation of 700 mm is well distributed throughout the year, with only light snowfalls.
